lead_paragraph: BERGMAN--Philip S.,former ABC News Producer for "20/20," "Nightline," "World News Tonight," "Good Morning America," and the "ABC Saturday Evening News," died on April 6, after a long battle with Alzheimer's Disease. He was 82 years old. Mr. Bergman was an American journalist and television news producer. He spent the bulk of his professional career with ABC News, producing news documentaries and stories for a variety of programs including "20/20", "Nightline", "World News Tonight" and the "ABC Saturday Evening News with Ted Koppel." Philip Bergman was born October 21, 1933 in New York City. After attending City College of New York, Mr. Bergman began his professional career as a reporter and editor at the Newark Star-Ledger and later worked as a reporter for United Press International. He served in the U.S. Army from 1957 to 1962, where he served as an Army correspondent. In 1962, Mr. Bergman joined ABC as a writer for WABC-TV News, and from 1964-1967 he produced WABC-TV's late night news program. In 1976, Mr. Bergman took the helm as Executive Producer for the ABC Saturday Evening News. After several years as a Senior Producer for ABC's "World News Tonight," Mr. Bergman went on to produce stories and segments for other prominent network news programs, including "Nightline" and "20/20." Over the course of his career, Phil Bergman won numerous awards including five national Emmy Awards, two national Headline Awards, a Christopher Award, and an Aviation and Space Writer's Award for TV and Radio. Loved and adored husband of late Irene for 46 years. Devoted father of sons, Michael and Jason. Loving father-in- law to Jill. Cherished grandfather of Hailey, Shari, Jordan, and Jared. Loving brother to late Cyril and Jules. Son of late parents Ruth and Irving Bergman. Graveside services are 11am, Friday, April 8, 2016 at Cedar Park Cemetery, 735 Forest Ave., Paramus, NJ. 1/3
